abstract.p: Retired urban and regional planner Ernest Erber letter on Louis Uchitelle's July 30 column holds if Congress believes US economy is threatened by too little unemployment, it should honor the unemployed with medals for heroism

block.p: Based on the column and other reports, one must conclude that our country continues to be guided by a conventional economic theory -- that our economy is threatened by too little unemployment. If Congress continues to believe in this theory, it should enact a law honoring our millions of unemployed, whose situation forestalls inflation and sustains prosperity. That law should require that each of these people receive a medal inscribed ''Hero of the Economy.''
ERNEST ERBER Red Hook, N.Y., July 31
The writer is a retired urban and regional planner.
